channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15665] Support using different StoreFileComparators for different CompactionPolicies
item.description: Now for DateTieredCompactionPolicy, if we output multiple files when compaction, we will use the same max sequence id for all the output files(see HBASE-15389 for more details). So we need to sort the store files by timestamp if they have the same max sequence id which is different from the original store file comparator.
item.summary: Support using different StoreFileComparators for different CompactionPolicies

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Add a getStoreFileComparator method to StoreFileManager.

Trivial change so no new tests.

Clara Xiong This can remove the extra sort in DateTieredCompactionPolicy. And this comparator will also be used to sort filesCompacting, which can be more reliable if we want to check overlapping when archiving.

Thanks.
Looks good to me.

172	  Comparator<StoreFile> getStoreFileComparator();

This method can be package private, right ?

This method can be package private, right ?

This is an interface so only public method is allowed...

Right.

I don't have other comment.
Patch for branch-1.
Patch for 0.98.

This message was automatically generated.

The failed tests are unrelated.

Will commit shortly.

Pushed to branch-1.3+ and 0.98.

Thanks all for reviewing.

For 0.98, the fingbugs and javadoc issues are not related, I have checked already.
Sean Busbey Any ideas that why pre commit always report findbugs and javadoc issue for 0.98?

Those are the reports for the state of the branch prior to the patch being applied. Those issues exist in the 0.98 branch, so they continue to show up.

This is the part that talks about after the patch:

+1 findbugs 4m 21s the patch passed
-1 javadoc 1m 33s hbase-server in the patch failed with JDK v1.8.0.
+1 javadoc 0m 40s the patch passed with JDK v1.7.0_79

The failure of javadoc under jdk1.8 is real, but since it failed prior to the patch it's hard to know if the patch makes things better or worse. AFAIK we have never done a jdk8 compatibility pass on that branch.
